title: Heimwehfluhbahn
text:
The Heimwehfluhbahn (DIH) is a <a href="funicular">funicular</a> at <a href="Interlaken">Interlaken</a> in the <a href="Switzerland">Swiss</a> <a href="Canton%20of%20Bern">Canton of Bern</a>. It runs to the top of the nearby <a href="Heimwehfluh">Heimwehfluh</a> hill at an altitude of <a href="Sea%20level%23AMSL">above sea level</a>. The funicular provides access to the hilltop restaurant, an observation tower, an <a href="O%20scale">O scale</a> model railway, a children's playground and a <a href="bobsleigh">bobsleigh</a> run (a second one existed but has since become overgrown and unused).
Overview.
The funicular, built between 1904 and 1906, has a length of and overcomes a vertical distance of with a maximum <a href="Grade%20%28slope%29">gradient</a> of 69%. There are two wooden cars dating from 1906, operating on a <a href="Single-track%20railway">single track</a> of <a href="Narrow-gauge%20railway">narrow gauge</a> track with a central passing loop. With curtains at the unglazed windows, the line presents an intentionally heritage image. A single journey takes 2 minutes.
